Shopkeeper

The Shopkeeper is a non-player character (NPC) found in the shops throughout the dungeon. He runs the Pixel-Mart chain of stores within the dungeon levels and offers various goods for purchase.

Description

This stout guy looks more appropriate for a trade district in some large city than for a dungeon. His prices explain why he prefers to do business here. The Shopkeeper is a stationary NPC that can be found in specially created shop rooms in various dungeon levels.

Role

* Sells items to the player character, including weapons, armor, scrolls, potions, and other equipment * Buys items from the player character * Provides a trading interface when interacted with * Restocks inventory periodically to maintain available items

Behavior

* Remains fixed in position and does not move * Immune to Regeneration effects * Can be damaged but will disappear immediately when attacked * Maintains a rotating inventory of items based on what's appropriate for the current dungeon level

Interactions

* When the player interacts with the Shopkeeper, the trading interface appears * Players can sell items from their inventory to the Shopkeeper * Players can buy items that the Shopkeeper has in stock * The Shopkeeper's inventory includes a mix of common and useful items

Shops

The Shopkeeper can be found in specially generated shop rooms throughout the dungeon. Different levels may have different types of shops: * General shops with basic equipment * Specialized shops in later levels with better items

Special Notes

* The Shopkeeper will never be hostile to the player * Some rare items may only be obtainable through shops * He will occasionally stock food, armor, weapons, and other equipment that can be crucial for survival
